verses.text: （大衛的詩，交給詩班長，調用“黎明的鹿」。）我的 神！我的 神！你為甚麼離棄我？為甚麼遠離不救我，不聽我呻吟的話呢？

words.note: The leading space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to denote God.
The leading space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to denote God.

verses.text: 我的 神啊！我日間呼求，你不應允；在晚上我還是不停止。

words.note: The leading space is a common convention in Chinese Bibles to denote God.
Often refers to prayer or desperate plea to God.

verses.text: 但你是聖潔的，是用以色列的讚美為寶座的。
我們的列祖倚靠你，他們倚靠你，你就救他們。
他們向你哀求，就得拯救；他們倚靠你，就不失望。
但我是蟲，不是人，是世上所羞辱的，也是眾人所藐視的。

words.note: Used metaphorically for abasement in biblical context.
Marks the following verb as the object of action, or forms a passive construction.

verses.text: 看見我的，都嘲笑我；他們撇著嘴，搖著頭，說：

words.note: Here, 'those who see me'.
An idiom describing a gesture of disdain.
An idiom describing a gesture of disapproval or dismay.

verses.text: 「他既然把自己交託耶和華，就讓耶和華搭救他吧！耶和華既然喜悅他，就讓耶和華拯救他吧！」

words.definition: to be pleased with, delight in

verses.text: 然而，是你使我從母腹中出來的；我在母親的懷裡，你就使我有倚靠的心。

words.note: Used here for emphasis on 'it was you who...'

verses.text: 我自出母胎，就被交託給你；我一出母腹，你就是我的 神。

words.note: Often used with 就 to mean 'as soon as... then...'
Refers to the Abrahamic God, capitalized in English Bibles.

verses.text: 求你不要遠離我，因為災難臨近了，卻沒有人幫助我。

words.note: Combined with '不' to mean 'don't'
Indicates completion or change of state

verses.text: 有許多公牛圍著我，巴珊強壯的公牛困住了我。

words.note: '著' indicates continuous action or state
Region in ancient Israel, known for fertile land and strong cattle.
Indicates completion or change of state

verses.text: 他們向我大大地張嘴，像抓撕吼叫的獅子。

words.note: Repetition of '大' emphasizes intensity; '地' forms adverb

verses.text: 我好像水被傾倒出去，我全身的骨頭都散脫了，我的心在我裡面像蠟融化。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state

verses.text: 我的精力像瓦片一樣枯乾，我的舌頭緊黏著上顎，你把我放在死亡的塵土中。

words.note: '著' indicates continuous action or state
Introduces the object of a verb
Often used as a suffix for location

verses.text: 犬類圍著我，惡黨環繞我，他們扎了（按照《馬索拉文本》，「他們扎了」作「像獅子」;現參照《七十士譯本》等古譯本翻譯）我的手我的腳。

words.note: Refers to the act of piercing.

verses.text: 我能數算我全身的骨頭，他們卻瞪著眼看我。

words.note: A fixed expression meaning to stare with eyes wide open.

verses.text: 他們彼此分了我的外衣，又為我的內衣抽籤。

words.note: Refers to the outer layer of clothing, often a cloak.
Refers to the undergarment or tunic.

verses.text: 至於你，耶和華啊！求你不要遠離我；我的力量啊！求你快來幫助我。

words.definition: stay away from, be far from

verses.text: 求你搭救我的性命脫離刀劍，搭救我的生命脫離惡狗的爪。
求你拯救我脫離獅子的口，拯救我脫離野牛的角。你已經應允了我。
我要向我的兄弟宣揚你的名，我要在聚會中讚美你。

words.note: Used as a suffix for location/context.

verses.text: 敬畏耶和華的人哪！你們要讚美他；雅各所有的後裔啊！你們都要尊敬他；以色列所有的後裔啊！你們都要懼怕他。
因為他不輕看，不厭惡受苦的人的痛苦，也沒有掩面不顧他；受苦的人呼求的時候，他就垂聽。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase with 時候 (shíhou).

verses.text: 在大會中，我讚美你的話是從你而來的；在敬畏耶和華的人面前，我要還我的願。

words.note: Used as a suffix for location/context.
Classical way of saying 'come from'.
Emphasizes the preceding clause as a descriptive unit.
Refers to a solemn promise, a vow.

verses.text: 受苦的人必吃得飽足，尋求耶和華的人必讚美他，願你們的心永遠活著！

words.note: Indicates necessity or strong certainty.
A resultative compound indicating satisfaction from eating.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 地的四極，都要記念耶和華，並且歸向他。列國的萬族，都要在他（「他」有古抄本作「你」）面前敬拜。

words.definition: four corners, ends of the earth
words.note: Refers to the farthest reaches of the world.
Commonly used in biblical contexts to refer to Gentile nations.
Refers to early handwritten copies of scripture.

verses.text: 因為國度是屬於耶和華的，他是掌管萬國的。

words.note: Often used in a spiritual or theological sense in the Bible.

verses.text: 地上所有富足的人，都必吃喝、敬拜；所有下到塵土中，不再存活的人，都在他面前屈身下拜。

words.note: Figuratively refers to death or the grave.
Implies a gesture of humility or reverence.

verses.text: 必有後裔服事他，必有人把主的事向後代述說。

words.note: Often refers to spiritual service or ministry.
A grammatical particle, often indicating disposal or handling of an object.
Refers to God or Jesus Christ in Christian contexts.

verses.text: 他們要把他的公義傳給以後出生的民，說明這是他所作的。

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
A core theological term.
Links an attribute/description to a noun.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb, meaning 'that which is V-ed'.
Combines with 所 and a verb to form a noun phrase.
